ACT
89
Calculation of gifts to the legal heir
For each legal heir, upon request, the value of everything he received as a gift from the testator in any way shall be included in the inheritance share.
The value of fruits and other benefits that the heir had from the donated thing until the death of the testator is not taken into account.
The value of the gift is not included if the testator declared at the time of the gift or later, or in the will, that the gift is not included in the inheritance, or it can be concluded from the circumstances that this was the will of the testator.
When calculating, the provisions on the necessary part apply, with the fact that the gifts received by the necessary heir are always included in the value of his necessary part.
